#Even-odd
num=int(raw_input()) #Taking first input which is actually not required in python but as question says

array=raw_input().split() #Taking input array and splitting in parts
array=[int(x) for x in array] #Converting each value in array to type "int"
result=0 #Result for our difference

for n in array:   #For every integer in array
     if n%2==0 :  #if number is even incrementing result 
       result=result+1
     else :
      result=result-1   #if number is odd decrementing result 
      
      
print abs(result) #giving absolute value of difference
